result.execSummary:
The defendant Chihene R Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful payment of fines.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. 

Firearm may be returned to the defendant.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:44 AM Defendant Chihene R Davis in court.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III in court for Chihene R Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct 2 NO CONTEST. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: Ct 2 GUILTY with Ct 1 being dismissed and read in.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defense requests gun be returned and case be expunged. 

BTC: Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$100 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $25/month beginning 12/1/2022. 

Court will return the firearm upon an order filed by Atty Forella. 
Court will expunge upon successful payment of fine.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.
